job.title: Mitarbeiter / -in im Lebensmittelbereich
job.plaincontent:
Für unsere Kunden im Raum Bern suchen wir laufend Mitarbeiter /- innen im Nahrungsmittelbereich (im 4-Schicht-Modell)
Mitarbeiter / -in im Lebensmittelbereich
Ihr Einsatz
- Unterstützung und Mitarbeit während der Lebensmittelproduktion - Mithilfe der Umrüstung von Abfüllanlagen - Weiterverarbeitung der Lebensmittel nach der Produktion - Qualitätskontrolle, Etikettieren und Verpacken der hergestellten Lebensmittel - Einhaltung der hygienischen Vorschriften gemäss GMP
Ihr Profil
- Du bringst bereits Erfahrung in der Lebensmittelproduktion mit - Bereitschaft in 4 Schicht Arbeit zu leisten, auch am Wochenende - Wohnhaft in Bern und Umgebung oder Eigenes Auto vorhanden - körperlich robust, belastbar - schnelle Arbeitsweise und gute Fingerfertigkeit - zuverlässig, hilfsbereit, flexibel - Teamplayer - Sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse - Verfügbar ab sofort
Interessiert?
Decken Sie unsere Anforderungen ab? Dann freue ich mich auf Ihre vollständigen Bewerbungsunterlagen

job.title: Verantwortliche/r Kommunikation und Events 50%, Zürich, unbefristet
job.plaincontent:
Verantwortliche/r Kommunikation und Events
50%, Zürich, unbefristet
ETH Wohnforum – ETH CASE Centre for Research on Architecture, Society & the Built Environment am Departement Architektur der ETH Zürich wurde 1990 gegründet und ist ein renommiertes interdisziplinäres Forschungszentrum für sozial- und kulturwissenschaftliche Analysen im Bereich Wohnforschung, Architektur, Raum- und Stadtentwicklung.
Infolge Pensionierung der jetzigen Stelleninhaberin suchen wir per 1. September 2020 oder nach Vereinbarung eine/n Verantwortliche/n Kommunikation und Events (50%).
Stellenbeschreibung
Wir sind ein dynamisches Wissenschaftsteam und denken kritisch in unserer täglichen Forschungspraxis. Unsere Herangehensweise ist interdisziplinär. Damit streben wir nach sinnvollen Lösungsvorschlägen und Praktiken, die zu einer ressourcenschonenden und sozialverträglichen Entwicklung, Gestaltung und Sicherung lebenswerter Städte und Wohnumwelten beitragen. Hierbei arbeiten wir, je nach Problemstellung, transdisziplinär mit Partnern aus der Verwaltung, Politik, Planung, dem Wohnungs-, Sozial- und Gesundheitswesen zusammen. Im Zentrum unserer Analyse stehen die Auswirkungen der demographischen und gesellschaftlichen Entwicklungen auf Wohnbedürfnisse und gelebte Wohnrealitäten. Wir untersuchen die Qualitäten des gebauten und gelebten Raums in Stadt- und Agglomerationsräumen und gewinnen daraus wichtige Erkenntnisse für die zukünftige ressourcenschonende und menschenfreundliche Planung.
Zu Ihren Aufgaben gehören:
- Verantwortung Kommunikation extern und ETH intern - Verantwortung Öffentlichkeitsarbeit des ETH Wohnforum – ETH CASE in Absprache mit der Leitung - Organisation und Unterstützung der jährlichen internationalen Jahrestagung „ETH Forum Wohnungsbau“ (org. Projektleitung) und von weiteren Veranstaltungen im Rahmen von Projekten am ETH Wohnforum - Verantwortung Sponsorenkontakte und -pflege - Koordination und Pflege von Medienkontakten
In der Funktion als Kommunikationsverantwortliche/r sind Sie direkt der Leitung ETH Wohnforum – ETH CASE unterstellt. Sie kooperieren mit der Leiterin des ETH Wohnforum – ETH CASE und den Projektleitenden und werden in Ihrer Arbeit von studentischen Hilfskräften unterstützt. Ihr Arbeitsplatz befindet sich an der ETH Zürich Hönggerberg und ist sehr gut mit öffentlichen Verkehrsmitteln zu erreichen. Die ETH bietet Ihnen zur Unterstützung der Vereinbarkeit von Familie und Beruf Kinderbetreuungsmöglichkeiten auf dem Campus. Home Office Möglichkeiten können besprochen werden.
Wir bieten ein vielfältiges, inspirierendes und respektvolles Arbeitsumfeld im Team mit der Möglichkeit, eigene Ideen und Initiativen einzubringen und zu entwickeln. Wir achten die unterschiedlichen Biografien unserer Mitarbeitenden und schätzen deren Vielfalt. Gleichbehandlung geniesst höchste Priorität.
Ihr Profil
- (Fach-)Hochschulabschluss oder gleichwertige Qualifikation sowie sehr gute Erfahrung im Bereich Kommunikation / Journalismus / Wissenschaftskommunikation - Hervorragende Kommunikationsfähigkeiten und perfektes Deutsch / Englisch in Wort und Schrift. Französisch von Vorteil. - Präsentationstalent - Organisationsstarke Persönlichkeit mit ausgeprägter Eigeninitiative und überzeugenden konzeptionellen Fähigkeiten - Sie arbeiten gerne in einem dynamischen Umfeld und sind ein/e Teamplayer/in. - Sie sind offen und interessiert am gesellschaftlichen Geschehen und an wissenschaftlichen Zusammenhängen des Wohnens, Architektur und Stadt- und Lebensräumen. - Sie denken vernetzt und unternehmerisch, sind in Peaks auch mal vielseitig belastbar. - Ein flexibles, aufgeschlossenes und begeisterungsfähiges Wesen zeichnet Sie aus.
ETH Zürich
Die ETH Zürich ist eine der besten technisch-naturwissenschaftlichen Hochschulen der Welt. Wir sind bekannt für unsere exzellente Lehre, wegweisende Grundlagenforschung und den direkten Transfer von neuen Erkenntnissen in die Gesellschaft. Über 30'000 Menschen aus mehr als 120 Ländern finden bei uns ein Umfeld, das eigenständiges Denken fördert, und ein Klima, das zu Spitzenleistungen inspiriert. Im Herzen Europas und weltweit vernetzt entwickeln wir gemeinsam Lösungen für die globalen Herausforderungen von heute und morgen.Arbeiten, Lehren und Forschen an der ETH Zürich

job.title: Native Mobile App Developer
job.plaincontent:
Drucken / als PDF speichern
comparis.ch ist der führende Internet-Vergleichsdienst in der Schweiz. Wir vergleichen Preise und Leistungen von Krankenkassen, Versicherungen, Banken, Telecom-Gesellschaften und Online-Shops. Mit unseren Marktplätzen unterstützen wir die User bei der Suche und Bewertung von Immobilien und Fahrzeugen. Unsere aktuellen Tipps und Tricks zu Konsumthemen bieten Benutzern eine zusätzliche Hilfe, um im Konsum-Dschungel den Überblick zu behalten. Damit wir auch in Zukunft das Leben der Konsumenten einfacher machen können, suchen wir für unser Office in Zürich einen
Native Mobile App Developer
Zu deinen Aufgaben gehören:
- Entwicklung, Weiterentwicklung und Betrieb von Mobile-Applikationen für unsere Auto- und Immobilienmarktplätze - Spezifikation, Design, Ausbau und Review von Native Mobile Applikationen für iOS und Android - Mitarbeit bei der Gestaltung und Implementierung der REST Schnittstellen - Requirements-Engineering und technisches Design in Zusammenarbeit mit Produktmanagern und Architekten
Wichtige Anforderungen sind:
- Abgeschlossene höhere Ausbildung im Bereich Informatik - Idealerweise 2 Jahre praktische Erfahrung als Mobile Software Entwickler - Erfahrung in Softwareentwicklung auf Android und/oder iOS - Kenntnisse in ASP.Net Web API sind ein Plus - Sehr gutes Verständnis von UI guidelines (Android und/oder iOS) - Freude am Designen von innovativen Anwendungen, die unsere User begeistern - Sehr gute Englischkenntnisse sowie gute Deutschkenntnisse (Team- und Firmensprache)
Was wir dir bieten:
- Ein hoch motiviertes Scrum-Team und eine grosse Portion Spass bei der Arbeit - Die Möglichkeit unsere APPs in enger Zusammenarbeit mit Produktmanagern aktiv zu gestalten - Gute Work-Life Balance (flexible Gestaltung von Arbeitszeit und unkomplizierte Ferienplanung, Sabbatical möglich) - Moderner Arbeitsplatz mit Stehtisch, Caféteria mit gratis Früchten, Snacks und Kaffee/Tee - Die Möglichkeit, an der Zukunft des führenden Schweizer Internet-Vergleichsdiensts und der hervorragend positionierten Marke comparis.ch mitzuwirken
Als innovatives und wachstumsstarkes Unternehmen bietet comparis.ch dir ein attraktives Arbeitsumfeld. Wenn dich die Herausforderung einer selbstständigen, abwechslungsreichen Aufgabe reizt und du dich beruflich weiterentwickeln willst, dann freuen wir uns auf deine vollständigen Bewerbungsunterlagen.
Zur besseren Lesbarkeit haben wir bei Personenbezeichnungen die männliche Form gewählt, jedoch beziehen sich die Angaben auf Angehörige aller Geschlechter.
Hinweis für Personalvermittler: Für diese Position berücksichtigen wir ausschliesslich Direktbewerbungen.
Online Bewerbung Online Bewerbung
comparis.ch Daniel Götze HR Business Partner +41 44 360 53 90 daniel.goetze@comparis.ch
TwitternVia Mail empfehlen

job.title: Test Engineer (f/m/d) Opto-Electronic Communication Systems
job.plaincontent:
Test Engineer (f/m/d) Opto-Electronic Communication Systems
Job ID: R0095950Location: Canton of Zurich, Switzerland Full time, Regular EmploymentThales people architect and deliver satellite-based systems that help position, connect and observe our planet, and push the boundaries of our understanding of planet's resources. Our systems are in orbit at 400 km, 20000 km, 36000 km and beyond to the edges of the solar system.
Thales Alenia Space Schweiz AG in Zurich, with its 75 employees, is the Swiss branch of the internationally operating Thales Alenia Space, which has been developing, integrating, testing and operating innovative and complex space systems for more than 40 years. Thales Alenia Space Switzerland technologies and products are used in the exploration of our solar system and the cosmos, earth observation and satellite telecommunications.
Test Engineer (f/m/d) Opto - Electronic Communication Systems
(Ref.no. R0095950) in space travel at our location in Zurich in Switzerland
You will enjoy having this responsibility:
- Definition of tests for electrical and optical communication systems for space applications - Preparation, organization, and execution of tests on equipment and system level - Definition of test specifications - Characterization of end-to-end electro-optical communication systems with focus on (Ethernet based) communication chains
This includes the following tasks:
- Together with our development team, you will be responsible for the design and engineering of test concepts and setups for sophisticated communication systems for space applications - As part of project proposals, you will support the bid team by providing technical inputs to plan the testing for telecommunication systems - You will analyze customer requirements related to communication interfaces and ensure that they can be verified using state-of-the-art test equipment and setups - During test campaigns, you will be responsible for the verification and validation of electrical and optical telecommunication interfaces as part of the test team - To increase efficiency, you will create, maintain, and supervise automated test environments - Based on test results, you will report defects and prepare the associated documentation - Occasionally, you will travel to test facilities or meetings and presentations with our international customers
Your background and skills:
- Degree in electrical engineering or equivalent work experience, ideally with specialized knowledge in electrical and optical telecommunication networks - Minimum 3 years of working experience in industry on similar job description - Familiar with the theory of electrical and optical telecommunication - Sound knowledge of electrical and optical telecommunication protocols like Ethernet, SONET/SDH, OTN/G.709. - Practical experience with standard tools for electrical and optical telecommunication interfaces with a throughput of 10Gbps and more (e.g., Bit Error Rate Tester (BERT), optical fiber tools and analyzer, Ethernet traffic generator/analyzer, multiplexers for different domains, …) - Experience with analogue RF and optical testing: extinction ratio, loss (transmission & return) measurements, 3dB bandwidth, S tests, isolation & cross-talk, E/O and O/E conversion, jitter, eye-diagrams, duty cycle, etc. - Experience with digital testing: packet-loss, BERT, Ethernet, error correction, etc. - Programming skills with: Python, MATLAB, C is a plus - Experience with using and developing test software to assist testing and test automation - Experience with system characterization and de-bugging - Experience in development and testing of opto-electronic equipment for space applications (advantageous) - Experience in environmental testing (advantageous) - Good command of English, both verbal and written; German or French would be an advantage - Good team player in a multidisciplinary environment - Flexible and eager to work in a multicultural group
As a global player with projects all over the world we are looking for candidates of different backgrounds and backgrounds, because the diversity of our innovative and creative teams is our success factor. Therefore, this is also a central aspect of our personnel selection.
You want to know more? We look forward to hearing from you:
Talent Acquisition Team Switzerland Tel .: +49 (0) 7156 353 42869
We look forward to receiving your application via our workday career portal.
For more information about Thales as an employer, visit www.thalesgroup.com/career
At Thales we provide CAREERS and not only jobs. With Thales employing 80,000 employees in 68 countries our mobility policy enables thousands of employees each year to develop their careers at home and abroad, in their existing areas of expertise or by branching out into new fields. Together we believe that embracing flexibility is a smarter way of working. Great journeys start here, apply now!
Apply now < Go Back to results
job.htmlcontent:
Test Engineer (f/m/d) Opto-Electronic Communication Systems

Job ID: R0095950Location: Canton of Zurich, Switzerland
Full time, Regular EmploymentThales people architect and deliver satellite-based systems that help position, connect and observe our planet, and push the boundaries of our understanding of planet's resources. Our systems are in orbit at 400 km, 20000 km, 36000 km and beyond to the edges of the solar system.

Thales Alenia Space Schweiz AG in Zurich, with its 75 employees, is the Swiss branch of the internationally operating Thales Alenia Space, which has been developing, integrating, testing and operating innovative and complex space systems for more than 40 years. Thales Alenia Space Switzerland technologies and products are used in the exploration of our solar system and the cosmos, earth observation and satellite telecommunications.

Test Engineer (f/m/d) Opto - Electronic Communication Systems

(Ref.no. R0095950)
in space travel at our location in Zurich in Switzerland

You will enjoy having this responsibility:

  • Definition of tests for electrical and optical communication systems for space applications
  • Preparation, organization, and execution of tests on equipment and system level
  • Definition of test specifications
  • Characterization of end-to-end electro-optical communication systems with focus on (Ethernet based) communication chains


This includes the following tasks:

  • Together with our development team, you will be responsible for the design and engineering of test concepts and setups for sophisticated communication systems for space applications
  • As part of project proposals, you will support the bid team by providing technical inputs to plan the testing for telecommunication systems
  • You will analyze customer requirements related to communication interfaces and ensure that they can be verified using state-of-the-art test equipment and setups
  • During test campaigns, you will be responsible for the verification and validation of electrical and optical telecommunication interfaces as part of the test team
  • To increase efficiency, you will create, maintain, and supervise automated test environments
  • Based on test results, you will report defects and prepare the associated documentation
  • Occasionally, you will travel to test facilities or meetings and presentations with our international customers

Your background and skills:

  • Degree in electrical engineering or equivalent work experience, ideally with specialized knowledge in electrical and optical telecommunication networks
  • Minimum 3 years of working experience in industry on similar job description
  • Familiar with the theory of electrical and optical telecommunication
  • Sound knowledge of electrical and optical telecommunication protocols like Ethernet, SONET/SDH, OTN/G.709.
  • Practical experience with standard tools for electrical and optical telecommunication interfaces with a throughput of 10Gbps and more (e.g., Bit Error Rate Tester (BERT), optical fiber tools and analyzer, Ethernet traffic generator/analyzer, multiplexers for different domains, …)
  • Experience with analogue RF and optical testing: extinction ratio, loss (transmission & return) measurements, 3dB bandwidth, S tests, isolation & cross-talk, E/O and O/E conversion, jitter, eye-diagrams, duty cycle, etc.
  • Experience with digital testing: packet-loss, BERT, Ethernet, error correction, etc.
  • Programming skills with: Python, MATLAB, C is a plus
  • Experience with using and developing test software to assist testing and test automation
  • Experience with system characterization and de-bugging
  • Experience in development and testing of opto-electronic equipment for space applications (advantageous)
  • Experience in environmental testing (advantageous)
  • Good command of English, both verbal and written; German or French would be an advantage
  • Good team player in a multidisciplinary environment
  • Flexible and eager to work in a multicultural group

As a global player with projects all over the world we are looking for candidates of different backgrounds and backgrounds, because the diversity of our innovative and creative teams is our success factor. Therefore, this is also a central aspect of our personnel selection.

You want to know more? We look forward to hearing from you:

Talent Acquisition Team Switzerland
Tel .: +49 (0) 7156 353 42869

job.title: Gleisbauer
job.plaincontent:
C. Vanoli AG
Gleisbauer 100% (w/m)
Sind Sie bereit für eine neue Herausforderung? Begeistern Sie mit uns unsere Kundschaft! Wir sind eine überregional tätige, mittelständische Bauunternehmung mit Hauptsitz in Immensee (SZ) und suchen zur Verstärkung unseres innovativen Teams per sofort oder nach Vereinbarung mehrere belastbare und flexible Persönlichkeiten als Gleisbauer. Diese Arbeiten erwarten Sie: Als Gleisbauer arbeiten Sie aktiv im gesamten Bereich des Gleisbaus mit. Dabei gehören unter anderem Reparaturen von Gleisanlagen und Weichen sowie das Ersetzen von Befestigungen und Erneuerungen von Schienen und Weichenteilen zu Ihren Hauptaufgaben. Zusätzlich helfen Sie bei Gleisneubauten mit, bauen Kabelkanäle und bedienen Kleingeräte wie Trenn- und Schienenbohrmaschinen. Bei Eignung und Interesse besteht die Möglichkeit eine berufsbegleitende Ausbildung als Vorarbeiter und / oder Polier zu absolvieren. Das sollten Sie mitbringen:
- Abgeschlossene bautechnische Ausbildung - Mehrere Jahre Berufserfahrung im Gleisbau - Sehr gute mündliche Deutschkenntnisse - Führerschein der Kategorie B - Bereitschaft für flexible Arbeitseinsätze sowie Nacht- und Wochenendarbeit - Selbständige, sorgfältige und exakte Arbeitsweise
Das bieten wir Ihnen:
- Langfristige Anstellung in einem Familienbetrieb - Anstellung nach GAV Gleisbau mit attraktiven Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten - Professionelle Einführung und Betreuung durch die Vorgesetzten - Abwechslungsreiches und herausforderndes Aufgabengebiet
Bei Fragen steht Ihnen Frau Séverine Jolidon (041 854 60 60) gerne zur Verfügung. Wir freuen uns auf Ihre vollständigen Bewerbungsunterlagen an personal@c-vanoli.ch oder untenstehende Postadresse (vorzugsweise per Email). C. Vanoli AG • Bauunternehmung • Artherstrasse 44 • CH-6405 Immensee Telefon 041 854 60 60 • Telefax 041 854 60 70 • personal@c-vanoli.ch • www.c-vanoli.ch 07. Juli 2020

job.title: Consultancy (11.5 months) Supporter Engagement Strategy (SES) - Supporter Experience Lead, Division of Private Fundraising and Partnerships, Switzerland
job.plaincontent:
UNICEF works in some of the world’s toughest places, to reach the world’s most disadvantaged children. To save their lives. To defend their rights. To help them fulfill their potential.
Across 190 countries and territories, we work for every child, everywhere, every day, to build a better world for everyone.
And we never give up.
For every child, hope
The Supporter Engagement Strategy is a mechanism to deliver UNICEF’s Strategic Plan 2018-2021 and the foundation for reaching the 2030 Sustainable Development Goals. It brings to life UNICEF’s goal of winning support for the cause of children from decision makers and the wider public. As a How Strategy, SES is a set of enablers empowering UNICEF colleagues to reach advocacy, public engagement and fundraising goals with individuals: driving positive supporter evolution and personalized supporter journeys worldwide; leveraging state-of-the-art technologies and information to customize experiences locally and fostering positive change and collaboration within UNICEF.
It is UNICEF’s united effort to bring together PFP, DOC, ICTD divisions, and Global Volunteers Office with National Committees and Regional and Country Offices and engage individuals to reach results for children and young people.
How can you make a difference?
The consultant will play a critical role in improving country capacity to deliver optimal supporter experience, commitment and loyalty, encompassing project administration, project execution and market roll outs. It will sit within Private Fundraising and Partnerships (PFP). The consultant will join as part of the Supporter Engagement Strategy (SES) team and will report to the SES Senior Coordinator.
The consultant will be tasked to help guide the target country’s application of supporter centered principles in the activities a strategy to enhance listening to, interacting with, and measuring satisfaction of individuals. In addition, the professional will co-lead in organizing project activities through communicating risks, opportunities, coordinating meetings and resources, equipment and information.
MAIN TASKS
The consultant will work closely with the Senior Coordinator to ensure supporter satisfaction and loyalty principles are ingrained in all activities of SES by providing guidance and leadership. The incumbent will also provide leadership in the organization of project plans, actions and deliverables.
Guidance focused on supporter experience, commitment and loyalty across SES activities (50%)
Support Senior Coordinator:
- Identify key areas where additional marketing and engagement support is needed, and work with the SES Team to fill them - Provide solutions, feedback and support as required by the Sr. Coordinator
Develop requirements and guidance to enhance supporter interaction and feedback are implemented in CORE
- Gather, assess and recommend engagement focused solutions from industry leaders and the experiences of UNICEF’s National Committees - Participate in Core Solution development activities providing expertise on supporter experience - Coordinate development of uses cases with a focus on satisfaction and loyalty
Help countries participating in the SES:
- Help develop local solutions (campaigns, journeys, etc.) as defined by Sr. Coordinator and agreed by participating countries - Assess needs of country teams to upgrade marketing strategy, and develop recommendations - Provide supporter focused guidance in countries participating in Core Solution to
- define business goals and engagement standards; - develop country specific supporter life cycle strategies
Project Coordination (50%)
- Coordinate, monitor and update project plans and schedules - Organizing, attending and participating in stakeholder meetings - Documenting and following up on important actions and decisions from meetings - Preparing necessary presentation materials for meetings - Ensuring project deadlines are met and provide progress reports on functions implemented and updates on the implementation of the solution - Determining project changes and submitting these to leadership team for agreement and approval - Developing project strategies ensuring views of all parties are considered, verified and validated, and appropriately prioritized to meet initiatives objectives - Assess project risks and issues and provide solutions where applicable
Across SES for both roles:
- Build and maintain key relationships across the organisation to ensure SES success - Be an ambassador for UNICEF and its supporters, supporting the delivery of the vision and ensuring that the charity’s profile and reputation are enhanced. - Assist in identifying and gathering industry tools and resources, and expanding external networks for UNICEF staff - Ensure stakeholder views are managed towards the best solution - Coordinate the documentation of project, including lessons learned and appropriate processes to be implemented - Project records and documents are properly handed over to business and technical leads with clear descriptions of ongoing roles and maintenance activities - Undertaking other project tasks as required
DELIVERABLES
The efficiency and effectiveness of support provided by the Supporter Experience Lead ensures that a strong relationship is built between the SES Initiative, UNICEF cross-divisional leadership, and ensure that colleagues in HQ and local offices have the desire, knowledge and ability to implement new ways of working.
Deliverables:
- Continual support to Senior Coordinator to improve supporter satisfaction in key countries, and to address project management matters of the CORE solution. - Recommendations to increase supporter interaction and feedback for global CORE solution, based on external best practices and internal consultation. - Provide leadership and solutions to countries seeking to transform their relationship with supporters using CRM technology, including improvement of personas, journeys and experience. - Better supporter centric knowledge bank to accelerate countries participating in CORE solution through resources, guides, tools, and technical assistance where needed. - Project plan to deliver on the priorities set by leadership, and integrating activities and team members detailed to SES, including budget and accountabilities. - Internal and external process improvements implemented, calendars, record keeping, and clear descriptions of ongoing roles and maintenance activities. - Project risks identified, and issues flagged when appropriate. - Briefing notes to project stakeholders prepared where needed, including progress reports, decks and presentations to leadership. - Documents lessons learned and appropriate documentation of the project.
ESTIMATED DURATION OF THE CONTRACT AND PROPOSAL
11.5 months, tentatively starting 17 August 2020
REPORTING TO
SES Senior Coordinator, Division of Private Fundraising and Partnerships
WORK PLACE
UNICEF Headquarters (NY, USA or Geneva, Switzerland). Teleworking is possible.
To qualify as an advocate for every child you will have…
- An advanced university degree in one of the following fields is required: Marketing, Communications, Non-profit or Business Management, or another relevant field. - A minimum of 8 years’ experience in marketing and project management required. - A minimum of 5 years’ experience as a principal in customer service projects focused on satisfaction and loyalty is highly desirable - Minimum of 3 years' experience in matrixed, multi-stakeholder projects with demonstrable results, and stakeholder satisfaction is highly desirable. - Experience with digital campaigning using CRM (ex: Salesforce) - Background in capacity building, training and change management. - Fluency in English is required. Working knowledge of another UN language is an asset.
For every Child, you demonstrate…
UNICEF's values of Care, Respect, Integrity, Trust, and Accountability (CRITA) and core competencies in Communication, Working with People and Drive for Results.
View our competency framework at http://www.unicef.org/about/employ/files/UNICEF_Competencies.pdf
Remarks: Please indicate your ability, availability and gross daily/monthly rate (in US$) to undertake the terms of reference above (including travel and daily subsistence allowance, if applicable). Applications submitted without a daily/monthly rate will not be considered. Also, please mention the earliest date you can start.
Individuals engaged under a consultancy or individual contract will not be considered “staff members” under the Staff Regulations and Rules of the United Nations and UNICEF’s policies and procedures, and will not be entitled to benefits provided therein. Their conditions of service will be governed by their contract and the General Conditions of Contracts for the Services of Consultants and Individual Contractors. Consultants and individual contractors are responsible for determining their tax liabilities and for the payment of any taxes and/or duties, in accordance with local or other applicable laws.
UNICEF is committed to diversity and inclusion within its workforce, and encourages all candidates, irrespective of gender, nationality, religious and ethnic backgrounds, including persons living with disabilities, to apply to become a part of the organization.
UNICEF has a zero-tolerance policy on conduct that is incompatible with the aims and objectives of the United Nations and UNICEF, including sexual exploitation and abuse, sexual harassment, abuse of authority and discrimination. UNICEF also adheres to strict child safeguarding principles. All selected candidates will be expected to adhere to these standards and principles and will therefore undergo rigorous reference and background checks. Background checks will include the verification of academic credential(s) and employment history. Selected candidates may be required to provide additional information to conduct a background check.

  • Be an ambassador for UNICEF and its supporters, supporting the delivery of the vision and ensuring that the charity’s profile and reputation are enhanced.
  • Assist in identifying and gathering industry tools and resources, and expanding external networks for UNICEF staff

  3. Provide leadership and solutions to countries seeking to transform their relationship with supporters using CRM technology, including improvement of personas, journeys and experience.
  4. Better supporter centric knowledge bank to accelerate countries participating in CORE solution through resources, guides, tools, and technical assistance where needed.
  5. Project plan to deliver on the priorities set by leadership, and integrating activities and team members detailed to SES, including budget and accountabilities.

  7. Project risks identified, and issues flagged when appropriate.

job.title: Graduate Strategic Planning Analyst
job.plaincontent:
Your team
Pictet Trading & Sales (PTS) provides direct access to global markets, offering bespoke trading solutions across a wide range of asset classes. Our sales traders, IT specialists, strategists and quant analysts are supported by a full suite of risk and control functions as well as the latest technology capabilities.
PTS is looking to hire a Graduate Strategic Planning Analyst to work with these teams.
This is a unique, 24-month experience where we offer you a permanent position along with a specific programme with rotations in different teams to build your expertise and professional skills. Based on a permanent contract, our graduate programmes include on- and off-the-job components, placing emphasis on teamwork but also exploring each individual's specific skillset, furthering their development and setting specific objectives.
During the programme you will work on one dedicated team and have the opportunity to do a series of immersions (lasting from one week to two months) on the trading floor, the aim being to build complementary skills, develop first-hand knowledge and familiarise yourself with our activities. The programme is also made of two different rotations (three to four months each) in different Pictet Group units and departments.
Your role
You will have access to a wide range of experts in the firm, gain a thorough grasp of the activities conducted on the trading floor and at the same time form part of an international graduate network. On the technical side you will prepare for a specific certification (e.g. CFA). Meanwhile, you will have the chance to develop your soft skills through our Group Training Programme.
This programme is an excellent foundation for starting your career with PTS. By the end you should be fully prepared to take on a role on the trading floor, with an in-house network of specialists at your disposal.
As a Graduate Strategic Planning Analyst, you will acquire a broad overview of the activities of the PTS Division while producing content and creating various databases for our four locations and maintaining permanent contact with the managers of our main areas of activity. With the general trend towards digitalisation and automation, you will play a significant part in developing our new technical tools, designing complex forecasts for PTS revenues and costs, producing structured presentations to facilitate strategic decision-making as well as working closely with our COO and top management.
Your profile
- Recent or soon-to-be graduate with a Master’s degree in Finance, Economics, Computer Science, Accounting or Business Administration from a top university. - Between six months’ and two years’ experience after graduation, preferably in an international environment. - Advanced knowledge of the Microsoft Office suite and strong interest in or skill with programming languages. (VBA, Python, SQL, JS, HTML/CSS). - An eye for detail and excellent organisational skills. - At ease in a challenging, noisy and multicultural working environment. - An enquiring mind and able to innovate, as well as being a strong team player. - Fluent in English and French; a good command of another language would be a plus. - Must be resident in Switzerland or willing to relocate.
As the chosen graduate you will show energy and enthusiasm in your work, be eager to learn, demonstrate a keen interest in finance and trading, and contribute by making use of the new approaches and technologies that you learned about in your studies.
Start date: 1 September 2020
Note
We will not accept any CVs via agencies.
REF: GSPA/SAS/AC
job.htmlcontent:
Your team

Pictet Trading & Sales (PTS) provides direct access to global markets, offering bespoke trading solutions across a wide range of asset classes. Our sales traders, IT specialists, strategists and quant analysts are supported by a full suite of risk and control functions as well as the latest technology capabilities.

 

PTS is looking to hire a Graduate Strategic Planning Analyst to work with these teams.

 

This is a unique, 24-month experience where we offer you a permanent position along with a specific programme with rotations in different teams to build your expertise and professional skills. Based on a permanent contract, our graduate programmes include on- and off-the-job components, placing emphasis on teamwork but also exploring each individual's specific skillset, furthering their development and setting specific objectives.

 

During the programme you will work on one dedicated team and have the opportunity to do a series of immersions (lasting from one week to two months) on the trading floor, the aim being to build complementary skills, develop first-hand knowledge and familiarise yourself with our activities. The programme is also made of two different rotations (three to four months each) in different Pictet Group units and departments.

Your role

 

You will have access to a wide range of experts in the firm, gain a thorough grasp of the activities conducted on the trading floor and at the same time form part of an international graduate network. On the technical side you will prepare for a specific certification (e.g. CFA). Meanwhile, you will have the chance to develop your soft skills through our Group Training Programme.

 

This programme is an excellent foundation for starting your career with PTS. By the end you should be fully prepared to take on a role on the trading floor, with an in-house network of specialists at your disposal.

 

As a Graduate Strategic Planning Analyst, you will acquire a broad overview of the activities of the PTS Division while producing content and creating various databases for our four locations and maintaining permanent contact with the managers of our main areas of activity. With the general trend towards digitalisation and automation, you will play a significant part in developing our new technical tools, designing complex forecasts for PTS revenues and costs, producing structured presentations to facilitate strategic decision-making as well as working closely with our COO and top management.

Your profile

 

  • Recent or soon-to-be graduate with a Master’s degree in Finance, Economics, Computer Science, Accounting or Business Administration from a top university.
  • Between six months’ and two years’ experience after graduation, preferably in an international environment.
  • Advanced knowledge of the Microsoft Office suite and strong interest in or skill with programming languages. (VBA, Python, SQL, JS, HTML/CSS).
  • An eye for detail and excellent organisational skills.
  • At ease in a challenging, noisy and multicultural working environment.
  • An enquiring mind and able to innovate, as well as being a strong team player.
  • Fluent in English and French; a good command of another language would be a plus.
  • Must be resident in Switzerland or willing to relocate.

 

As the chosen graduate you will show energy and enthusiasm in your work, be eager to learn, demonstrate a keen interest in finance and trading, and contribute by making use of the new approaches and technologies that you learned about in your studies.

Start date: 1 September 2020

Note

We will not accept any CVs via agencies.

REF: GSPA/SAS/AC

job.title: IT Risk & Compliance Manager
job.plaincontent:
Votre équipe
Vous rejoindrez l’équipe Risk & Compliance de la division Technologies et Opérations, qui est notamment en charge de la gestion proactive et de la prévention des risques technologiques et opérationnels ainsi que de la surveillance de la conformité aux règles internes et externes.
Votre rôle
• Participer à l’établissement de la cartographie des risques technologiques et du profil de risque. • Contribuer à l’identification des tendances et des nouveaux risques technologiques. • Participer à la définition/revue de la tolérance aux risques technologiques, développer de nouveaux indicateurs clés de risque et assurer leur suivi. • Piloter et animer le dispositif de système de contrôle interne pour la partie technologies et en assurer le suivi des contrôles. • Assurer le suivi des plans de limitation des risques et de mise en oeuvre des recommandations d’audit, puis établir un reporting périodique sur l’état d’avancement. • Coordonner les travaux et les réponses relatifs aux questionnaires d’appels d’offres et de due diligence ainsi qu’aux demandes reçues des différentes autorités de surveillance suisses et étrangères • Etre la personne de référence pour l’audit interne et externe et apporter un soutien aux collaborateurs pendant les audits. • Assurer des échanges réguliers avec les risk managers et les compliance officers des lignes de métier et des fonctions centrales du Groupe en matière de risques technologiques et d’évaluation du système de contrôle interne.
Votre profil
• Formation universitaire en systèmes d’information ou formation jugée équivalente, et certification CISA (Certified Information System Auditor) ou ITIL. • Expérience 3- 5 ans dans le domaine du Risk & Compliance ou en tant qu’auditeur/trice informatique dans le domaine bancaire ou financier (cabinet d’audit, ou expérience professionnelle jugée équivalente.) • Connaissances techniques (systèmes, bases de données, réseaux, sécurité, etc.) ainsi que maîtrise des processus et risques informatiques ; connaissance du logiciel bancaire Avaloq: un atout. • Connaissance de la réglementation bancaire internationale en matière de systèmes d’information. • Maîtrise des applications bureautiques usuelles (en particulier MS Office/Excel) et connaissance de Tableau Software: un plus. • Français et anglais parlé et écrit. • Domicile en Suisse requis.
Note We will not accept any CVs via agencies
job.htmlcontent:
Votre équipe

Vous rejoindrez l’équipe Risk & Compliance de la division Technologies et Opérations, qui est notamment en charge de la gestion proactive et de la prévention des risques technologiques et opérationnels ainsi que de la surveillance de la conformité aux règles internes et externes.

Votre rôle

• Participer à l’établissement de la cartographie des risques technologiques et du profil de risque.
• Contribuer à l’identification des tendances et des nouveaux risques technologiques.
• Participer à la définition/revue de la tolérance aux risques technologiques, développer de nouveaux indicateurs clés de risque et assurer leur suivi.
• Piloter et animer le dispositif de système de contrôle interne pour la partie technologies et en assurer le suivi des contrôles.
• Assurer le suivi des plans de limitation des risques et de mise en oeuvre des recommandations d’audit, puis établir un reporting périodique sur l’état d’avancement.
• Coordonner les travaux et les réponses relatifs aux questionnaires d’appels d’offres et de due diligence ainsi qu’aux demandes reçues des différentes autorités de surveillance suisses et étrangères
• Etre la personne de référence pour l’audit interne et externe et apporter un soutien aux collaborateurs pendant les audits.
• Assurer des échanges réguliers avec les risk managers et les compliance officers des lignes de métier et des fonctions centrales du Groupe en matière de risques technologiques et d’évaluation du système de contrôle interne.
 

Votre profil

• Formation universitaire en systèmes d’information ou formation jugée équivalente, et certification CISA (Certified Information System Auditor) ou ITIL.
• Expérience 3- 5 ans dans le domaine du Risk & Compliance ou en tant qu’auditeur/trice informatique dans le domaine bancaire ou financier (cabinet d’audit, ou expérience professionnelle jugée équivalente.)
• Connaissances techniques (systèmes, bases de données, réseaux, sécurité, etc.) ainsi que maîtrise des processus et risques informatiques ; connaissance du logiciel bancaire Avaloq: un atout.
• Connaissance de la réglementation bancaire internationale en matière de systèmes d’information.
• Maîtrise des applications bureautiques usuelles (en particulier MS Office/Excel) et connaissance de Tableau Software: un plus.
• Français et anglais parlé et écrit.
• Domicile en Suisse requis.

Note We will not accept any CVs via agencies

job.title: Fixed Income Buy-Side Analyst & Deputy Fund Manager
job.plaincontent: Bei Julius Bär fördern wir unsere Mitarbeitenden auf allen Ebenen: Junge Talente führen wir im Rahmen unseres renommierten Bankausbildungsprogramms an den Beruf heran. Ehrgeizige Universitätsabgänger erhalten bei uns die Möglichkeit, ihre theoretischen Kenntnisse im Rahmen unseres Absolventenprogramms in die Praxis umzusetzen. Und erfahrenen Berufsprofis, die den nächsten Karriereschritt planen, bieten wir erstklassige Weiterentwicklungsmöglichkeiten. Wir sind an langfristigen Beziehungen interessiert. Daher legen wir grossen Wert auf das Wohlergehen unserer Mitarbeitenden und bieten flexible Arbeitsmöglichkeiten, eine breite Palette von Leistungen und umfangreiche Programme zur Karriereentwicklung. Julius Bär ist die führende Private-Banking-Gruppe der Schweiz, ausgerichtet auf die Betreuung und Beratung anspruchsvoller Privatkunden, sowie eine erstklassige Marke im globalen Wealth Management. Deshalb sind ein umfassendes Leistungsspektrum und eine erstklassige Dienstleistungsqualität unerlässlich – und engagierte Teams, die dahinter stehen. We are looking for three experienced portfolio managers / credit analyst to join our Fixed Income Investment Management team, in order to support the bank’s successful and growing discretionary fixed income mandates and building-block fixed income funds operation. Please apply specifically for one of the following Fixed Income Buy-Side Analyst & Deputy Fund Manager positions: 1) INVESTMENT GRADE, with main coverage focus: FINANCIALS, UTILITIES, REITs, GREs, SUPRAs 2) HIGH YIELD, with main coverage focus: US HIGH YIELD 3) EMERGING MARKETS, with main coverage focus: CEEMEA IHRE AUFGABEN The Fixed Income Buy-Side Analysts & Deputy Fund Managers complement the existing credit team, working closely with the Lead Managers of the respective three Fixed Income strategies and with the broader Fixed Income Investment Management (FI IM) operation of Bank Julius Baer. The FI IM team is responsible for the bank’s discretionary fixed income investment management globally ex-Asia. It is composed of twelve specialists with diverse international backgrounds. The team has generated superior risk adjusted performance since 2017 by combining institutional and private wealth management processes, talent and execution. The operation is fully aligned with client interest. Fixed Income mandates, building-block investment funds and certificates are all managed within the same team. The role involves notably the following tasks: - Perform fundamental sector analysis for assigned sectors / regions / market segments from both a bottom-up credit quality perspective and relative value - Perform detailed fundamental credit analysis of corporate issuers and relative value analysis for issuers and bonds across multiple currencies in the assigned market segments and sectors - Perform financial modelling, scenario and covenant analysis on complex credits and corporate actions - Select and monitor the broad credit selection eligible for building-block bond funds, as well as the core credit selection eligible for single-line use in discretionary mandates - Perform deputy fund manager responsibilities, help implement the investment strategy across formats (fund, AMC, mandates) according to specific investment guidelines - Help optimise the fund’s risk-adjusted performance against market benchmarks and peers - Together with the lead manager, be accountable for the resulting performance and represent it both internally and to clients - Contribute towards internal and external communications, e.g. fund manager reports, strategy updates, investment proposals, prospective client meetings - Support the FI IM team in different tasks and projects, e.g. model portfolio construction and bespoke portfolio analyses - Build/maintain relationships with financial counterparties (syndicates, sales desks), corporate debt issuers as well as analysts; meet and visit issuers in roadshows, perform due diligence - Ensure compliance with all policies and guidelines of the JB Group The role offers a challenging, dynamic and diverse workflow with team colleagues, management and other staff across functions and geographies. IHRE FÄHIGKEITEN - University degree, Masters and/or CFA advantageous - Min. 7 years (or more) working experience as credit analyst and fixed income fund/portfolio manager - Meaningful in-depth credit analysis experience in one of the three target market segments - Proven fund/ portfolio management track record in one of the three target market segments - Passion for investing and a buy-side oriented mind-set grounded in a thorough understanding of risks and solid judgment - Entrepreneurial mind-set thriving on the chance of contributing to the further development of JB fixed income franchise - Outstanding analytical skills, quantitative, detail-oriented, ability to think critically and form independent opinions - Flexible, independent and structured working style, capacity to manage multiple tasks in a dynamic environment and ability to work under pressure - Strong communication and presentation skills, experience in client interaction - Very good written and spoken command of English, other languages advantageous - Able to quickly establish credibility and trust, teamwork skills, client- and service-oriented personality - Strong Bloomberg (AIM), MS Excel, MS Powerpoint and other IT skills (Python or other programming and Triple-A experience useful) HR Kontakt: Anna Janssen, Talent Acquisition Specialist Wir freuen uns auf die Zusendung Ihrer vollständigen Bewerbungsunterlagen. Bitte nutzen Sie hierzu unser Online-Bewerbungstool. Weitere interessante Jobangebote finden Sie auf der Homepage oder in der Übersicht der vergleichbaren Stellen.
job.htmlcontent:
Bei Julius Bär fördern wir unsere Mitarbeitenden auf allen Ebenen: Junge Talente führen wir im Rahmen unseres renommierten Bankausbildungsprogramms an den Beruf heran. Ehrgeizige Universitätsabgänger erhalten bei uns die Möglichkeit, ihre theoretischen Kenntnisse im Rahmen unseres Absolventenprogramms in die Praxis umzusetzen. Und erfahrenen Berufsprofis, die den nächsten Karriereschritt planen, bieten wir erstklassige Weiterentwicklungsmöglichkeiten. Wir sind an langfristigen Beziehungen interessiert. Daher legen wir grossen Wert auf das Wohlergehen unserer Mitarbeitenden und bieten flexible Arbeitsmöglichkeiten, eine breite Palette von Leistungen und umfangreiche Programme zur Karriereentwicklung.

</div>

Julius Bär ist die führende Private-Banking-Gruppe der Schweiz, ausgerichtet auf die Betreuung und Beratung anspruchsvoller Privatkunden, sowie eine erstklassige Marke im globalen Wealth Management. Deshalb sind ein umfassendes Leistungsspektrum und eine erstklassige Dienstleistungsqualität unerlässlich – und engagierte Teams, die dahinter stehen.

We are looking for three experienced portfolio managers / credit analyst to join our Fixed Income Investment Management team, in order to support the bank’s successful and growing discretionary fixed income mandates and building-block fixed income funds operation.

Please apply specifically for one of the following Fixed Income Buy-Side Analyst & Deputy Fund Manager positions:
1) INVESTMENT GRADE, with main coverage focus: FINANCIALS, UTILITIES, REITs, GREs, SUPRAs
2) HIGH YIELD, with main coverage focus: US HIGH YIELD
3) EMERGING MARKETS, with main coverage focus: CEEMEA

IHRE AUFGABEN

The Fixed Income Buy-Side Analysts & Deputy Fund Managers complement the existing credit team, working closely with the Lead Managers of the respective three Fixed Income strategies and with the broader Fixed Income Investment Management (FI IM) operation of Bank Julius Baer.

The FI IM team is responsible for the bank’s discretionary fixed income investment management globally ex-Asia. It is composed of twelve specialists with diverse international backgrounds. The team has generated superior risk adjusted performance since 2017 by combining institutional and private wealth management processes, talent and execution.

The operation is fully aligned with client interest. Fixed Income mandates, building-block investment funds and certificates are all managed within the same team.

The role involves notably the following tasks:

  • Perform fundamental sector analysis for assigned sectors / regions / market segments from both a bottom-up credit quality perspective and relative value
  • Perform detailed fundamental credit analysis of corporate issuers and relative value analysis for issuers and bonds across multiple currencies in the assigned market segments and sectors
  • Perform financial modelling, scenario and covenant analysis on complex credits and corporate actions
  • Select and monitor the broad credit selection eligible for building-block bond funds, as well as the core credit selection eligible for single-line use in discretionary mandates
  • Perform deputy fund manager responsibilities, help implement the investment strategy across formats (fund, AMC, mandates) according to specific investment guidelines
  • Help optimise the fund’s risk-adjusted performance against market benchmarks and peers
  • Together with the lead manager, be accountable for the resulting performance and represent it both internally and to clients
  • Contribute towards internal and external communications, e.g. fund manager reports, strategy updates, investment proposals, prospective client meetings
  • Support the FI IM  team in different tasks and projects, e.g. model portfolio construction and bespoke portfolio analyses
  • Build/maintain relationships with financial counterparties (syndicates, sales desks), corporate debt issuers as well as analysts; meet and visit issuers in roadshows, perform due diligence 
  • Ensure compliance with all policies and guidelines of the JB Group

The role offers a challenging, dynamic and diverse workflow with team colleagues, management and other staff across functions and geographies.

IHRE FÄHIGKEITEN

  • University degree, Masters and/or CFA advantageous
  • Min. 7 years (or more) working experience as credit analyst and fixed income fund/portfolio manager
  • Meaningful in-depth credit analysis experience in one of the three target market segments
  • Proven fund/ portfolio management track record in one of the three target market segments
  • Passion for investing and a buy-side oriented mind-set grounded in a thorough understanding of risks and solid judgment
  • Entrepreneurial mind-set thriving on the chance of contributing to the further development of JB fixed income franchise
  • Outstanding analytical skills, quantitative, detail-oriented, ability to think critically and form independent opinions
  • Flexible, independent and structured working style, capacity to manage multiple tasks in a dynamic environment and ability to work under pressure
  • Strong communication and presentation skills, experience in client interaction
  • Very good written and spoken command of English, other languages advantageous
  • Able to quickly establish credibility and trust, teamwork skills, client- and service-oriented personality
  • Strong Bloomberg (AIM), MS Excel, MS Powerpoint and other IT skills (Python or other programming and Triple-A experience useful)

HR Kontakt: Anna Janssen, Talent Acquisition Specialist

Wir freuen uns auf die Zusendung Ihrer vollständigen Bewerbungsunterlagen. Bitte nutzen Sie hierzu unser Online-Bewerbungstool. Weitere interessante Jobangebote finden Sie auf der Homepage oder in der Übersicht der vergleichbaren Stellen.

- Overview - Success - Life at Takeda - Opportunity - Responsibilities - Map
Overview
Every day, employees working in Takeda’s Global Manufacturing and Supply Chain, and Global Quality business unit are shaping the future of healthcare. They are breaking down barriers and ensuring our life-changing medicines are available, accessible, and affordable to patients. Life-changing for you. Life-changing for patients.
Global Manufacturing and Supply Chain, and Global Quality is the backbone of Takeda, and our employees are the guardians for our patients, our products, and our reputation. As a member of our team, we can offer you the opportunity to grow in a meaningful career, develop your skills, and come to work every day knowing that what you do makes a genuine difference.
Back to Job Navigation (Overview)
Success

- Agile - Ambitious - Analytical - Collaborative - Enthusiastic - Entrepreneurial

Life at Takeda
-
A Global Top Employer
Recognized for our culture and way of working, we’re one of only select companies to receive Top Global Employer® status for 2020.

At Takeda, your determination and energy, combined with our cutting-edge technology and global R&D, offers families and communities hope for Better Health and a Brighter Future.

About Takeda
At Takeda, there is an unwavering commitment to putting patients first, and to creating a workplace that is underpinned by empowerment and focused on diversity, collaboration and steadfast values.

- Innovation
Bold initiatives, continuous improvement, and creativity are at the heart of how we bring scientific breakthroughs from the lab to patients.
- Inclusive

- Empowerment
Through trust and respect, you will have genuine support from leaders, managers, and colleagues to do your best work.
- Collaboration
A strong, borderless team, we strive together towards our priorities and inspiring mission.
- Top Workplace

- Work-Life
Our people-first mission extends beyond patients to include their families, communities, and our own Takeda family.

Data Integrity Project Specialist
Apply Now Job ID SR0049992 Date posted 06.25.2020 Location Neuchâtel, Switzerland
Takeda Neuchâtel
Site de Production Biotech | Biotech Manufacturing Site
Takeda is an industry-leading, global pharmaceutical company with an unwavering dedication to putting patients at the center of everything we do. We live our values of Takeda-ism – Integrity, Fairness, Honesty, and Perseverance – and are united by our mission to strive towards Better Health and a Brighter Future for people worldwide through leading innovation in medicine.
Here, everyone matters, and you will be a vital contributor to our inspiring, bold mission. At Takeda, you will make an impact on people’s lives – including your own.
Data Integrity Project Specialist
Data Integrity Project Specialists
12-month assignment (August 2020 – July 2020)
Takeda’s Neuchatel Manufacturing plant is looking for two highly motivated Project Specialists for a period of 12 months to work on project focused on Data Integrity.
Your mission
Within the Manufacturing support department, the purpose of this role to provide the technical expertise needed to participate in a Data Integrity project within the manufacturing process and to act as a catalyst for continuous improvement.
Essential Duties & Responsibilities
- Support the Data Integrity project for the whole manufacturing plant
- Participate in the meetings related to this project - Follow-up on the assigned actions related to the scope of this project
- Lead, perform and review risk/gap assessments related to the manufacturing equipment and associated data. - Work on actions linked to production-related gap and risk assessment: participate in change control and documentation updates activities - Work on actions linked to gap assessment and risk assessment (production related) - Perform quality and manufacturing technical aspect reviews for the equipment
Required Skills
- Demonstrated experience in manufacturing and/or data integrity projects - Confirmed experience with automated systems used in biotechnology industry - Expertise in Quality/Compliance within an FDA regulated/GMP manufacturing field required - Ability to provide solutions to satisfy business objectives and cost implications within timelines - Structured systems thinking with good technical understanding of operations - Ability to think and act cross-functionally, interacting with experts, SME’s, engineers etc. - Project management training or experience is an asset (from URS to implementation)
Personal qualities
- Interpersonal skills, self-motivated, capable of analyzing and solving problems - Great team player prepared to work in and embrace a team-based culture and more specifically within the manufacturing teams directly on the production floor - Excellent oral and written skills in English and French - Ability to describe processes and qualifications and to translate them into clear, precise reports
Working Environment
- While this is a day-time job, must be able to work on occasions in controlled environments requiring special gowning. Will be required to follow gowning requirements and wear protective clothing over the head, face, hands, feet and body.
Notice to Employment / Recruitment Agents:
Employment / Recruitment agents may only submit candidates for vacancies only if they have written authorization to do so from Shire, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Takeda’s Talent Acquisition department. Any agency candidate submission may only be submitted to positions opened to the agency through the specific Agency Portal. Shire, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Takeda will only pay a fee for candidates submitted or presented where there is a fully executed contract in place between the Employment / Recruitment agents and Shire, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Takeda and only if the candidate is submitted via the Agency Portal. Candidates submitted or presented by Employment / Recruitment Agents without a fully executed contract or submitted through this site shall not be deemed to form part of any Engagement for which the Agency may claim remuneration.

Takeda is an industry-leading, global pharmaceutical company with an unwavering dedication to putting patients at the center of everything we do. We live our values of Takeda-ism – Integrity, Fairness, Honesty, and Perseverance – and are united by our mission to strive towards Better Health and a Brighter Future for people worldwide through leading innovation in medicine.

Here, everyone matters, and you will be a vital contributor to our inspiring, bold mission. At Takeda, you will make an impact on people’s lives – including your own.

Data Integrity Project Specialist

Data Integrity Project Specialists

12-month assignment (August 2020 – July 2020)

Takeda’s Neuchatel Manufacturing plant is looking for two highly motivated Project Specialists for a period of 12 months to work on project focused on Data Integrity.

Your mission

Within the Manufacturing support department, the purpose of this role to provide the technical expertise needed to participate in a Data Integrity project within the manufacturing process and to act as a catalyst for continuous improvement.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities

  • Support the Data Integrity project for the whole manufacturing plant
    • Participate in the meetings related to this project
    • Follow-up on the assigned actions related to the scope of this project
  • Lead, perform and review risk/gap assessments related to the manufacturing equipment and associated data.
  • Work on actions linked to production-related gap and risk assessment: participate in change control and documentation updates activities
  • Work on actions linked to gap assessment and risk assessment (production related)
  • Perform quality and manufacturing technical aspect reviews for the equipment

    Required Skills

  • Demonstrated experience in manufacturing and/or data integrity projects
  • Confirmed experience with automated systems used in biotechnology industry
  • Expertise in Quality/Compliance within an FDA regulated/GMP manufacturing field required
  • Ability to provide solutions to satisfy business objectives and cost implications within timelines
  • Structured systems thinking with good technical understanding of operations
  • Ability to think and act cross-functionally, interacting with experts, SME’s, engineers etc.
  • Project management training or experience is an asset (from URS to implementation)

    Personal qualities

  • Interpersonal skills, self-motivated, capable of analyzing and solving problems
  • Great team player prepared to work in and embrace a team-based culture and more specifically within the manufacturing teams directly on the production floor
  • Excellent oral and written skills in English and French
  • Ability to describe processes and qualifications and to translate them into clear, precise reports

    Working Environment

  • While this is a day-time job, must be able to work on occasions in controlled environments requiring special gowning. Will be required to follow gowning requirements and wear protective clothing over the head, face, hands, feet and body.

Notice to Employment / Recruitment Agents:

Employment / Recruitment agents may only submit candidates for vacancies only if they have written authorization to do so from Shire, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Takeda’s Talent Acquisition department. Any agency candidate submission may only be submitted to positions opened to the agency through the specific Agency Portal. Shire, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Takeda will only pay a fee for candidates submitted or presented where there is a fully executed contract in place between the Employment / Recruitment agents and Shire, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Takeda and only if the candidate is submitted via the Agency Portal. Candidates submitted or presented by Employment / Recruitment Agents without a fully executed contract or submitted through this site shall not be deemed to form part of any Engagement for which the Agency may claim remuneration.

Expert Assurance Qualité (QA) - Zone Aseptique
Apply Now Job ID SR0050864 Date posted 07.07.2020 Location Neuchâtel, Switzerland
Takeda est l’entreprise de biotechnologie leader dans le domaine des maladies rares et complexes à l’échelle mondiale. Nos efforts visent à développer les meilleurs médicaments, dont de nombreux sont déjà disponibles dans plus de 100 pays. Nos principaux domaines thérapeutiques comprennent l’hématologie, l’immunologie, les maladies de surcharge lysosomale, autres anomalies ou maladies génétiques, les neurosciences, la gastro-gastroentérologie, la médecine interne et, désormais de manière renforcée, l'oncologie.
EXPERT(E) ASSURANCE QUALITE (QA) Zone Aseptique
L’équipe d’Assurance Qualité de Takeda de Neuchâtel (site de production dans le secteur de l’hématologie d’environ 650 employés) est à la recherche d’un poste d’Expert en Assurance Qualité.
Ce poste est une opportunité de carrière passionnante pour une personne dynamique, autonome, ayant un esprit d’amélioration continue, prêt à intégrer et à adopter une culture fondée sur le travail d’équipe.
Votre mission
Dans cette fonction, vous serez responsable de l’Assurance Qualité dans le cadre des activités tout au long des processus de production et de libération.
L’expert en Assurance Qualité est le représentant Assurance Qualité pour les activités de routine BPF (Bonnes Pratiques de Fabrication) et les projets de Takeda. Il/elle assurera la qualité des informations dans les systèmes et la documentation en ce qui concerne les directives, la conformité et les exigences réglementaires actuelles.
La participation aux audits BPF fera partie des activités.
L’expert en Assurance Qualité fera la promotion et sera impliqué dans l’amélioration continue.
Responsabilités principales
- Participer aux activités quotidiennes liées à la revue des dossiers de lot et des données associées pour la libération des lots en zone aseptique - Participer à la revue et évaluation des demandes de changement (”change control”) selon les procédures, méthodes, systèmes qualité et des dossiers règlementaires applicables pour répondre aux exigences du siège social, divisionelles et règlementaires -
Fournir le support QA aux activités de maintenance et des installations
- Maintenir le ”mapping” organisé des variants de procédés (les codes produits) - Apporter du support quant à la résolution des problèmes/des causes à l’origine des déviations et CAPA - Exécuter les audits GMP internes en zone de production - Etre un leader dans l’implémentation des projets du site en accord avec les exigences réglementaires et le département Qualité
Profil recherché
- Vous êtes titulaire d’un CFC ou HES ou diplôme universitaire en Ingénierie, Biotechnologie, Pharmacie ou « Quality Management » appliqué aux procédés industriels ou expérience équivalente dans des sociétés pharmaceutiques et /ou biotechnologiques. - Idéalement 5 années d’expérience en Assurance Qualité. Expérience en contrôle qualité également considérée, spécifiquement microbiologie. - Connaissance des réglementations FDA, EMA, ICH, Pharmacopées et des normes système Qualité. - Connaissance des audits et inspections selon les normes règlementaires / qualité. - Expérience avec la disposition de produit. - Orienté solution et capacité à simplifier la complexité. - Excellent sens de l’écoute avec une aisance dans la communication et un fort esprit d’équipe - Maitrise du français et niveau intermédiaire, idéalement supérieure en langue anglaise - Bon sens de l’organisation et un état d’esprit « amélioration continue ». - Caractère dynamique et volontaire
Takeda-isme
Nos valeurs nous servent de boussole. Le « Takeda-isme » nous donne une assise solide pour assurer le respect de notre mission qui est l’amélioration de la vie des patients, en nous comportant avec intégrité dans toutes nos actions au nom et pour le patient.
- Intégrité - Equité - Honnêteté - Persévérance
Nos priorités
Nous prenons des décisions selon nos quatre priorités, suivant cet ordre :
1) Mettre le patient au centre
2) Générer la confiance avec la société
3) Renforcer notre réputation
4) Développer nos activités
Notice to Employment / Recruitment Agents:
Employment / Recruitment agents may only submit candidates for vacancies only if they have written authorization to do so from Shire, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Takeda’s Talent Acquisition department. Any agency candidate submission may only be submitted to positions opened to the agency through the specific Agency Portal. Shire, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Takeda will only pay a fee for candidates submitted or presented where there is a fully executed contract in place between the Employment / Recruitment agents and Shire, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Takeda and only if the candidate is submitted via the Agency Portal. Candidates submitted or presented by Employment / Recruitment Agents without a fully executed contract or submitted through this site shall not be deemed to form part of any Engagement for which the Agency may claim remuneration.

Expérience en contrôle qualité également considérée, spécifiquement microbiologie. - Connaissance des réglementations FDA, EMA, ICH, Pharmacopées et des normes système Qualité. - Connaissance des audits et inspections selon les normes règlementaires / qualité. - Expérience avec la disposition de produit. - Orienté solution et capacité à simplifier la complexité. - Excellent sens de l’écoute avec une aisance dans la communication et un fort esprit d’équipe - Maitrise du français et niveau intermédiaire, idéalement supérieure en langue anglaise - Bon sens de l’organisation et un état d’esprit « amélioration continue ». - Caractère dynamique et volontaire
Takeda-isme
Nos valeurs nous servent de boussole. Le « Takeda-isme » nous donne une assise solide pour assurer le respect de notre mission qui est l’amélioration de la vie des patients, en nous comportant avec intégrité dans toutes nos actions au nom et pour le patient.
- Intégrité - Equité - Honnêteté - Persévérance
Nos priorités
Nous prenons des décisions selon nos quatre priorités, suivant cet ordre :
1) Mettre le patient au centre
2) Générer la confiance avec la société
3) Renforcer notre réputation
4) Développer nos activités
Notice to Employment / Recruitment Agents:
Employment / Recruitment agents may only submit candidates for vacancies only if they have written authorization to do so from Shire, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Takeda’s Talent Acquisition department. Any agency candidate submission may only be submitted to positions opened to the agency through the specific Agency Portal. Shire, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Takeda will only pay a fee for candidates submitted or presented where there is a fully executed contract in place between the Employment / Recruitment agents and Shire, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Takeda and only if the candidate is submitted via the Agency Portal. Candidates submitted or presented by Employment / Recruitment Agents without a fully executed contract or submitted through this site shall not be deemed to form part of any Engagement for which the Agency may claim remuneration.

Takeda est l’entreprise de biotechnologie leader dans le domaine des maladies rares et complexes à l’échelle mondiale. Nos efforts visent à développer les meilleurs médicaments, dont de nombreux sont déjà disponibles dans plus de 100 pays. Nos principaux domaines thérapeutiques comprennent l’hématologie, l’immunologie, les maladies de surcharge lysosomale, autres anomalies ou maladies génétiques, les neurosciences, la gastro-gastroentérologie, la médecine interne et, désormais de manière renforcée, l'oncologie.

EXPERT(E) ASSURANCE QUALITE (QA) Zone Aseptique

L’équipe d’Assurance Qualité de Takeda de Neuchâtel (site de production dans le secteur de l’hématologie d’environ 650 employés) est à la recherche d’un poste d’Expert en Assurance Qualité.

Ce poste est une opportunité de carrière passionnante pour une personne dynamique, autonome, ayant un esprit d’amélioration continue, prêt à intégrer et à adopter une culture fondée sur le travail d’équipe.

Votre mission

Dans cette fonction, vous serez responsable de l’Assurance Qualité dans le cadre des activités tout au long des processus de production et de libération.

L’expert en Assurance Qualité est le représentant Assurance Qualité pour les activités de routine BPF (Bonnes Pratiques de Fabrication) et les projets de Takeda. Il/elle assurera la qualité des informations dans les systèmes et la documentation en ce qui concerne les directives, la conformité et les exigences réglementaires actuelles.

La participation aux audits BPF fera partie des activités.

L’expert en Assurance Qualité fera la promotion et sera impliqué dans l’amélioration continue.

Responsabilités principales

  • Participer aux activités quotidiennes liées à la revue des dossiers de lot et des données associées pour la libération des lots en zone aseptique
  • Participer à la revue et évaluation des demandes de changement (”change control”) selon les procédures, méthodes, systèmes qualité et des dossiers règlementaires applicables pour répondre aux exigences du siège social, divisionelles et règlementaires

  • Fournir le support QA aux activités de maintenance et des installations

  • Maintenir le ”mapping” organisé des variants de procédés (les codes produits)
  • Apporter du support quant à la résolution des problèmes/des causes à l’origine des déviations et CAPA
  • Exécuter les audits GMP internes en zone de production
  • Etre un leader dans l’implémentation des projets du site en accord avec les exigences réglementaires et le département Qualité

Profil recherché

  • Vous êtes titulaire d’un CFC ou HES ou diplôme universitaire en Ingénierie, Biotechnologie, Pharmacie ou « Quality Management » appliqué aux procédés industriels ou expérience équivalente dans des sociétés pharmaceutiques et /ou biotechnologiques.
  • Idéalement 5 années d’expérience en Assurance Qualité. Expérience en contrôle qualité également considérée, spécifiquement microbiologie.
  • Connaissance des réglementations FDA, EMA, ICH, Pharmacopées et des normes système Qualité.
  • Connaissance des audits et inspections selon les normes règlementaires / qualité.
  • Expérience avec la disposition de produit.
  • Orienté solution et capacité à simplifier la complexité.
  • Excellent sens de l’écoute avec une aisance dans la communication et un fort esprit d’équipe
  • Maitrise du français et niveau intermédiaire, idéalement supérieure en langue anglaise
  • Bon sens de l’organisation et un état d’esprit « amélioration continue ».
  • Caractère dynamique et volontaire

Takeda-isme

Nos valeurs nous servent de boussole. Le « Takeda-isme » nous donne une assise solide pour assurer le respect de notre mission qui est l’amélioration de la vie des patients, en nous comportant avec intégrité dans toutes nos actions au nom et pour le patient.

  • Intégrité
  • Equité
  • Honnêteté
  • Persévérance

Nos priorités

Nous prenons des décisions selon nos quatre priorités, suivant cet ordre :

1) Mettre le patient au centre

2) Générer la confiance avec la société

3) Renforcer notre réputation

4) Développer nos activités
